name: Vegan Eclairs and Cream Puffs
description: Learn how to make vegan eclairs, cream puffs or profiteroles, using this simple recipe for eggless choux pastry that actually works!
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup aquafaba (liquid from a can of chickpeas, measured before whisking)
powdered sugar, for dusting cream puffs

recipeInstructions.text: Before beginning, prepare either vegan custard or coconut whipped cream, or both, if desired. Let the custard and/or coconut whip chill in the refrigerator while you prepare the pastry.
recipeInstructions.name: Before beginning, prepare either vegan custard or coconut whipped cream, or both, if desired. Let the custard and/or coconut whip chill in the refrigerator while you prepare the pastry.

itemListElement.text: In a medium saucepan, add the vegan butter, water, soy milk, salt and sugar and heat to medium. Stir with a wooden spoon or spatula until the butter has melted, then bring it a simmer.
itemListElement.name: In a medium saucepan, add the vegan butter, water, soy milk, salt and sugar and heat to medium. Stir with a wooden spoon or spatula until the butter has melted, then bring it a simmer.

itemListElement.text: Reduce the heat to low and add the flour all at once. Stir until the flour is mixed in and a ball of dough forms. Cook the dough in the pan for 2 minutes, mashing the bottom against the bottom of the pan.
itemListElement.name: Reduce the heat to low and add the flour all at once. Stir until the flour is mixed in and a ball of dough forms. Cook the dough in the pan for 2 minutes, mashing the bottom against the bottom of the pan.

itemListElement.text: Transfer the dough to the bowl of a stand mixer (or a large bowl) and let cool for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Transfer the dough to the bowl of a stand mixer (or a large bowl) and let cool for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Prepare egg substitute: In a medium bowl, pour in the 1/4 cup aquafaba, then add the potato starch, tapioca starch, baking powder and xantham gum. Using a whisk, mix the powder into the aquafaba until it becomes foamy, about 1-2 minutes. (SEE PHOTOS in post above for visual reference.)
itemListElement.name: Prepare egg substitute: In a medium bowl, pour in the 1/4 cup aquafaba, then add the potato starch, tapioca starch, baking powder and xantham gum. Using a whisk, mix the powder into the aquafaba until it becomes foamy, about 1-2 minutes. (SEE PHOTOS in post above for visual reference.)

itemListElement.text: With the stand mixer on low speed, with the paddle attachment, add nearly all of the egg replacer the the dough mixture, leaving just a tablespoon or two in the bowl for brushing on the pastry before baking. Alternatively, you can use a hand mixer, or even a food processor. Mix until combined, about 30 seconds to 1 minute.
itemListElement.name: With the stand mixer on low speed, with the paddle attachment, add nearly all of the egg replacer the the dough mixture, leaving just a tablespoon or two in the bowl for brushing on the pastry before baking. Alternatively, you can use a hand mixer, or even a food processor. Mix until combined, about 30 seconds to 1 minute.

itemListElement.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly brush it with water, which helps them puff up and not dry out. Transfer the pastry dough to a piping bag with a large tip (Wilton 1A or other large tip). For cream puffs or profiteroles, pipe mounds about 2 inches tall, a few inches apart on the parchment paper. For eclairs, make them mini, about 1 inch tall and 3 inches long.
itemListElement.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly brush it with water, which helps them puff up and not dry out. Transfer the pastry dough to a piping bag with a large tip (Wilton 1A or other large tip). For cream puffs or profiteroles, pipe mounds about 2 inches tall, a few inches apart on the parchment paper. For eclairs, make them mini, about 1 inch tall and 3 inches long.

itemListElement.text: Brush a little egg replacer on each one, gently. Bake in the center rack of the oven for 20 minutes at 375℉, then without opening the door, lower the heat to 350℉ and bake for 10 more minutes until golden. Remove from oven and transfer to a cooling rack. Allow them to cool completely before slicing open and filling.
itemListElement.name: Brush a little egg replacer on each one, gently. Bake in the center rack of the oven for 20 minutes at 375℉, then without opening the door, lower the heat to 350℉ and bake for 10 more minutes until golden. Remove from oven and transfer to a cooling rack. Allow them to cool completely before slicing open and filling.

itemListElement.text: Slice the pastry in half and pipe a large mound of coconut whipped cream (or custard) on the bottom half. Place the top pastry half on top, gently, then dust with powdered sugar or dip the top in chocolate sauce.
itemListElement.name: Slice the pastry in half and pipe a large mound of coconut whipped cream (or custard) on the bottom half. Place the top pastry half on top, gently, then dust with powdered sugar or dip the top in chocolate sauce.

itemListElement.text: Prepare the chocolate topping: Place the chocolate chips and soy milk in a bowl and microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute, stirring until it's completely melted and smooth.
itemListElement.name: Prepare the chocolate topping: Place the chocolate chips and soy milk in a bowl and microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute, stirring until it's completely melted and smooth.

itemListElement.text: Slice the eclair pastry in half, lengthwise, and pipe a good amount of custard onto the bottom half. Dip the top of the pastry into the chocolate, then place on top of the custard.
itemListElement.name: Slice the eclair pastry in half, lengthwise, and pipe a good amount of custard onto the bottom half. Dip the top of the pastry into the chocolate, then place on top of the custard.

itemListElement.text: Store vegan eclairs and cream puffs in the refrigerator for 2-3 days in a covered container. They can also be frozen, but are better fresh.
